extendedInfo.description: Track your Debt Snowball - this app allows you to enter and track your debts - and calculates balances and payoff dates based on the Debt Snowball method (pay the minimums on everything, and attack smallest debt first), as recommended by financial counselors such as Dave Ramsey.This IS a very basic app - written in response to the fact that when we started the Dave Ramsey plan in March 2010, there was no simple free app available that could do exactly the bit of functionality I needed. Basic Instructions:1. Add your debts, including minimum payments, APR, original (for payoff display) and current amounts.2. The app will display your debts in a list from SMALLEST to LARGEST. This is the 'debt snowball' - yes it is not mathematically optimal, but for many people is better psychologically.3. In 'settings', set the 'Extra' monthly amount you expect to be able to apply to debt.4. Pay the MINIMUM only on ALL debts except the top one on the list. Any extra disposable income should be applied to the SMALLEST debt to get it paid off.5. The app calculates your payoff dates based on your 'Extra' monthly payment, so you can easily change your 'Extra' payment to see how taking a 500/month part time job can accelerate your overall payoff time. If you leave "Extra" = 0, then you are essentially planning to make minimum payments ONLY.6. The first time you open the app each month, it will re-calculate (based on APR, minimum payments, and applying the amount you have saved as 'Extra' towards the smallest debt) what your current balances for all debts should be. If you pay more than the minimum on some debts, or the 'Extra' amount is not correct, you can also manually adjust those balances - but if the data is all correct, the new balances should all auto-calculate properly at the beginning of each month.

reviews.title: Uh oh...
reviews.comment: please fix...won\'t let me open it. I use the snowball faithfully. Please fix! I don\'t want to lose my data.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: What does it really do?
reviews.comment: Either I can\'t tell or this app actually does nothing but create a bar showing what percentage you have paid off. Which you probably already know. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Andrew Pfeifer

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.comment: Ok, it\'s not Dave Ramsey\'s debt snowball, but it is just as good as a reminder for you to stay in check with your debt. I think it\'s awesome!
reviews.author: Jill Gabbert

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.comment: The creator meant well but when you spend time entering data and it disappears, it\'s worse than dealing with the debt itself. Maybe an update? For now I am deleting.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Its ok
reviews.comment: Its a good general tool, but it doesn\'t accept decimals so you have to update it manually every few months. Its great to get an attack plan; not worth keeping long term.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Simple and sleek
reviews.comment: I am one that over complicates my budget, and snowball. This really help me keep thing simple and at my finger tips, great app!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.comment: I put all my debts in and it erased them all
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No
reviews.comment: Waste of time. Too simple
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Eh..
reviews.comment: It doesn\'t tell you anything really. Basically bar graphs showing what you have already paid.
reviews.author: David Cole

reviews.title: Atrix
reviews.comment: Awesome, just what I was looking for!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Go Dave !
reviews.comment: Just was I was looking for, hope to see more work into it for better graphics and easier use. Thanks
reviews.author: Gerald A Polanco

reviews.title: I like it but!
reviews.comment: It keeps foreclosing! Motorola Xoom!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Quick and easy to use on my HTC inspire . 5 stars.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not bad.
reviews.comment: Mine is keeping its memory. Glad I\'m down to just four sets including my home. But.... Is all it does is show me my current debts, and that\'s it? Need a small readme.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Force closes
reviews.comment: Latest update did not, evidently, fix the force-close issue. Neat little app...wish it still worked. :(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Erased everything
reviews.comment: Stupid app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Simple and lets me see total debts and expected pay off day
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great for basic debts! Needs some upgrades to handle student loans. Hope to see that soon.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Very basic. Moved to Debt Payoff Planner. Much better app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: No instructions how how it works. Doesn\'t allow you to enter the amount you pay per month if above min. pmt.
reviews.author: A Google User
